p: However, there are a few existing small-molecule drugs that might help. For instance, an experimental antiviral called galidesivir developed for treating Ebola is active against coronaviruses, says its US maker, BioCryst Pharmaceuticals. It has already passed safety tests in people. A team in China has identified four existing, approved drugs that might also work: prulifloxacin, bictegravir, nelfinavir and tegobuvir (bioRxiv, doi.org/dk2z).
